Review_Text: Cody is a great example. It's about more than music. It's about more than even chasing a dream. It's about listening to God, following your heart, and finding yourself and happiness along the way. Incredible story brother. God bless you.

Review_title: A Soul-Stirring Tribute to Cody Johnson's Unwavering Spirit
Review_Text: SpoilerI just finished watching "Dear Rodeo: The Cody Johnson Story" and I must say, it's a documentary that will leave you feeling inspired, uplifted, and maybe even a little bit wiser. As a fan of Cody Johnson's music, I was excited to dive into his story and learn more about the man behind the songs. What I got was so much more than I expected - a heartfelt, honest, and deeply personal look at Cody's life, struggles, and passions.From the opening scenes, it's clear that Cody Johnson is a complex and multifaceted individual, driven by a fierce determination to succeed and a deep love for his family, his music, and the rodeo. The documentary takes us on a journey through Cody's childhood, his early days as a rodeo rider, and his eventual transition to country music stardom. Along the way, we meet the people who have shaped his life, including his family, friends, and mentors, and we get a glimpse into the struggles he's faced, from injuries and setbacks to self-doubt and uncertainty.One of the things that struck me most about this documentary is its honesty. Cody Johnson is unflinchingly candid about his flaws, his fears, and his mistakes, and he's willing to confront his demons head-on. He talks openly about the struggles he's faced, from the physical toll of rodeo riding to the emotional strain of touring and performing. He shares stories about the times he's felt lost, alone, and uncertain, and he talks about the ways in which he's learned to cope with stress, anxiety, and self-doubt.But even as Cody confronts his struggles, he remains steadfastly optimistic, driven by a fierce passion for his music and a deep commitment to his fans. He talks about the ways in which music has saved him, lifted him up, and given him a sense of purpose, and he shares stories about the people who have inspired him, from his family and friends to his musical heroes.Throughout the documentary, we're treated to stunning footage of Cody's live performances, as well as intimate glimpses into his songwriting process. We see him crafting songs, rehearsing with his band, and performing to sold-out crowds, and we get a sense of the hard work, dedication, and perseverance that have gone into building his career.What I loved most about "Dear Rodeo" is the way it captures Cody Johnson's spirit - his kindness, his humility, and his generosity. He's a man who is deeply rooted in his values, who is committed to his family and his community, and who is driven by a desire to make a positive impact on the world. He's a true artist, a man who is willing to take risks, push boundaries, and challenge himself to grow and evolve.As I watched "Dear Rodeo," I found myself feeling happy, inspired, and uplifted. Cody Johnson's story is a reminder that we all have the power to create our own destiny, to pursue our passions, and to make a difference in the world. It's a testament to the human spirit, a celebration of the power of music to heal, to inspire, and to bring us together.In short, "Dear Rodeo: The Cody Johnson Story" is a must-see documentary that will leave you feeling inspired, motivated, and maybe even a little bit changed. It's a tribute to Cody Johnson's unwavering spirit, a celebration of his music, and a reminder of the power of perseverance, hard work, and determination. If you're a fan of Cody Johnson, or if you just love music, storytelling, and inspiration, then this documentary is a must-watch. So grab some popcorn, settle in, and get ready to be moved, inspired, and uplifted by the incredible story of Cody Johnson.
